p: Minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) was determined for all EOs and the mixture with the broth microdilution method, starting from a dilution of 10% ( v/ v) and following the guidelines of CLSI [ 31] for bacteria and CLSI M27A 3 for yeasts [ 32], and a protocol previously reported [ 20]. The MIC value was determined as the lowest concentration, expressed in mg/mL, for each EO and the mixture at which bacteria and yeast showed no visible growth. The same assay was performed simultaneously for microorganisms growth control (tested agents and media) and sterility control (tested oil or mixture and media).
